title: The Fire
description: A fire in the kitchen relegates the staff to the parking lot as help is on its way.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Dunder Mifflin, this is Pam. Sure, can I ask who's calling? Just a second.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Jim Halpert. What? How did you get this number? Stalker.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Katy and Jim met in the office. And now I guess they're like going out, or dating, or something. And, uh... I don't know! You know? They're just... She calls him, and they... You know, I'm sorry. I feel like I'm talking really loud. Am I talking really loud?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: So we're still on for lunch? You're meeting me here? Okay. Great. Bye.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [to Jim] Hey! You can just give her your extension.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Howard, slash Ryan, Ryan Howard is sitting in my office. And he has been a temp here for a couple of months and he's kind of gotten the lay of the land a little bit. Had a few laughs along the way. And now he wants to know what I think.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: The temp agency wants to know what you think.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Shall we? Let us proceed. First up, proficiency in necessary skills. Aaaaeeexcellent! [laughs]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Michael's in there right now evaluating the temp. He hasn't evaluated me in years.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Five years from now, what do you want to do? Where do you want to be?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Ah, well, I'm interested in business.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh! Good. Ambitious. Excellent. Want to be a manager?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Uh, no, actually, uh, what I want is to own my own company.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That is ridiculous.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ryan's about to attend the Michael Scott School of Business. I'm like Mr. Miyagi and Yoda rolled into one.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [speaks in a Yoda voice] Much advice you seek. [regular voice] Do you know who that is?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Fozzie bear?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Mmm... No. That was Yoda.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: There are ten rules of business that you need to learn.  Number one:

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [to Ryan] [makes clicking noises like shooting a gun] Hey!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Michael and I have a very special connection. He's like Batman, I'm like Robin. He's like the Lone Ranger, and I'm like Tonto. And it's not like there was the Lone Ranger, and Tonto, and Bonto.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: [in background, on phone] But it says no late fee... .

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [alarm sounds] People!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Okay! Everybody!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: This is not a test! Move to the exits!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Do not panic!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Head towards the exits.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Safety partners.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Get up off your desks!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Do not panic.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: [in phone] No, I don't hear it? Alright.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No, panic is warranted!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Go in single file lines.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: [in phone] No, no. Finish the...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: This is not at drill!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Arms at your sides! Arms at your sides!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Please, move quickly! This is a paper company, people! Step lively!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Go, let's go.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: This whole place is a tinder box, it is ready to blow!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: This is not a test! Can you leave?!

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Oh, you say that every time.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: DO YOU WANT TO DIE?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Oh, boy...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Do you want to die? OUT!!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Alright, let's go, let's go.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: STANLEY! Have you ever seen a burn victim?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Come on, you're safety partners!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Move to the exits!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: You're safety partners!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: We've got smoke! We've got smoke! Smoke! Gah! [Spots Kelly] Oh, Kelly! You're okay! I've got you!

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: I'm okay!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Cover your nose and mouth. Breathe through your nose.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Let go of me!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Breathe through your nose. Remove your stockings. Okay? They'll melt right into your flesh! Stay below the smoke line. Let's go! Clear out, stat! STAT MEANS NOW!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes, I was the first one out. And, yes, I've heard women and children first. But, we do not employ children. We are not a sweat shop. Thankfully. And, uh, women are equal in the workplace by law. So, I let them out first, I have a lawsuit on my hands.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Another rule of business is being able to adapt to different situations.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Adapt. React. Re-adapt. Act. All right? That's rule number two.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay, guys, listen up, we need a head count. We need to count off. Michael's number one. Where is he? Where is he?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So what was rule two?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Ah... adapt, react, re-adapt, act.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, well, let's... . let's kind of take it a little slower.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hey, Michael. Um... Ryan needs his number for the count off.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, uh, well, one is taken.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Uh, okay, two?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: NO!

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Okay... uh, sorry?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay, he can have 14. Marjory's not here today.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, he needs a permanent number, right?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: ...I don't.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, you know what else? I thought of a nickname for the three of us. Three Musketeers.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Um, yeah.  Okay. That... No, no, no. I got one. I got one. The Three Stooges.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: That's funny, too. But if we're the Three Musketeers...

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I don't want to be like "a guy" here. You know? Like, Stanley is the "crossword puzzle guy". And Angela has cats. I don't want to have a thing... here. You know, I don't want to be the "something guy".

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay, you know what?  I am going to be, uh, setting the agenda here. Okay? Can everybody gather up, please? Important announcement. Very important announcement. I think this is a perfect opportunity for all of us to participate in some really intense, psychologically revealing conversations. So we're going to be playing Desert Island, umm, Who Would You Do?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Ooh.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: And, um...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: ...Would You Rather?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Would You Rather. Would You Rather is our third game.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [to firemen] Hey guys, great response time. Listen up, I got some theories. Okay, there's a...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay, so... three books on a desert island? Angela.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: The Bible.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: That's one book. You've got two others.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: A Purpose Driven Life.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Nice. Third book?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay. Phyllis.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Um, The DaVinci Code.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: The DaVinci Code!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Nice.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I would take The DaVinci Code... so I could burn The DaVinci Code.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay. Great, that's going to keep you warm for like 7 seconds. Question:

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Rule number four. In business, image is everything - Andre Agassi. This car is an investment. Right? If I have to take out a client or I'm seen around Scranton in it. I love it. I love this car. Do you like it?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay. Thought people read more books.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: DVDs! Five movies. What would you bring to the island?  Yes! Meredith?

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Legends of the Fall, My Big Fat Greek Wedding, Legally Blond, Bridges of Madison County...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Wow.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Legends of the Fall?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Wow. Bridges of Madison County, Legally Blond, these movies are just... .

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Well, I kind of liked Legal...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Wait, wait, wait. Pam. No. Do you understand? The... the game is Desert Island Movies, not guilty pleasure movies. Desert Island Movies are the movies you're going to watch for the rest of your life! Forever! Unforgivable.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I take it back.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Unforgivable.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I take it back!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Good.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: ...and Ghost. But, ah, just that one scene...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Is this your car, Ryan?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Wow, some pretty big books back there, huh?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: [to Dwight] Don't...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Good shocks.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hello, Mr. Egghead! Woop!  So... oh, Stanley Kaplan! I know him. 'M' is for Murder, 'P' is for...

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: That's actually a test prep book.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: ...for Phone. What?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: That's a test prep for business school.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Um, oh, thinking about business school?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I just got in. I applied, I go at night.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So you think you know a lot about business?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: No, not yet.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Uh huh.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Just started.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah. Quiz me.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I... wouldn't even know where to start.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Come on, egghead. Let's do it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Do it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Quiz me up.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: All right, um... Why have people been rethinking the Microsoft model in the past few years?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Uh...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: When I was Ryan's age, I worked in a fast food restaurant, to save up money for school. And then I spe... lost it in a pyramid scheme. But I learned more about business, right then and there, than business school would ever teach me, or Ryan would ever teach me.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Is it cheaper to sign a new customer? Or to keep an existing customer?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Keep an existing...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [to Dwight] Shut, it. Can I... can I just do it please? [to Ryan] Uh, it's equal.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: It is ten times more expensive to sign a new customer.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay. Yes! It was a trick question.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah, but look, I mean, he didn't need business school. Okay, Michael comes from the school of hard knocks.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Self taught. You didn't even go to college.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know what, Dwight? You don't need to help me here. Okay? Well, you know... Maybe you should go to business school like Ryan, then... then you'd know what you're talking about.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [scoffs] Come on. I'm studying with the master, huh?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: For instance, why don't you go to business...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [to Ryan] You should learn from him, right?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I am.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Right?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I am.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Stop. Dwight. You know what? You're acting like a dork. Would you cool it? Please. Okay. Hey! He's not your five year old brother, Dwight. He's a valued member of this company... and you know what? He knows more about business than you ever will.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Stupid!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I did not go to business school. You know who else didn't go to business school? LeBron James, Tracy McGrady, Kobe Bryant. They went right from high school to the NBA. So... so it's not the same thing. At all.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Look at this stuff. Market fragments. What is that supposed to be?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: It's a way of looking at consumers as subsets of a larger client base.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You are so smart. You are so eff-in' smart. You should be teaching me.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Pam? Get us back into it.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Five movies. Go ahead.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Um, Fargo, um, Edward Scissorhands, Dazed and Confused...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Ooh, definitely in my top five.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yes. In my top three, so suck it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Breakfast Club. Um... The Princess Bride and...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay that's five.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No, my all time favorite!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Pam, play by the rules.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: All time favorite.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Play by the rules. Dwight. All time favorite movie.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: The Crow.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I became a salesman... because of people, I love making friends. But then I was promoted to manager, at a very young age. I still try to be a friend first, but... You know? I'm very successful... your coworkers look at you differently. Huu, what do you think?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Maybe we should get some air.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Nah, I'm okay.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I'm really uncomfortable.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: All right. Let's move on. Let's move on to the main event. Who Would You Do?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Present company excluded?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Um, not neccessari...

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Pam.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Pam.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Um... okay. Ah, you know what? Maybe I'll... I'll finish explaining the rules. Let's... let me explain it first, and then...

quotes.speaker: Song
quotes.text: ["Everybody Hurts" by R.E.M.] Think you've had too much / in this life.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah, so we'll get right... You know what? I'll be right back. Stanley, you're taking over for me, buddy. I'll be right back.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Okay, um...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Dwight. Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Song
quotes.text: Everybody hurts,

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Come on Dwight! Use words.

quotes.speaker: Song
quotes.text: Sometim... .

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Why didn't I go to business school?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Who goes to business school?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: The temp.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: He does?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah, it's all him and Michael talk about anymore.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You know, I bet Ryan thinks to himself 'I wish I were a volunteer sheriff on the weekends'.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: He doesn't even know that I do that.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You should tell him.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh yeah, Pam. Right. That's going to help things, just talk it out. I hope the war goes on forever and Ryan gets drafted.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I'm sorry I said that, I didn't... just part of me meant it. Besides, he'd end up being a hero anyway.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You know what you should do? You should quit. And then, that would stick it to both of them.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh Jim, I'm not going to quit. Then Ryan wins.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah. You're right.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Thanks you guys. I just need some alone time.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Kay.

quotes.speaker: Song
quotes.text: Everybody hurts

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Alright buddy.

quotes.speaker: Song
quotes.text: Everybody cries

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Hey! Guys, what's going on?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Nothing.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey!

quotes.speaker: Song
quotes.text: Everybody hurts

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: What's up? Can I hang out with you guys for a bit?

quotes.speaker: Song
quotes.text: Sometimes

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: The warehouse guys are a bunch of jackasses sometimes.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Come on people, you know the rules of the game now.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, hey. Game, what game are we playing here?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Okay. It's called Who Would You Do?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, I play this at home all the time while I'm falling asleep. What, uh... . Where are we? Where are we here?  Mmm.. Roy? Roy? Who would you do, Roy?

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Uh... Oh, I got it! Uh, what's the name of that, uh, tight ass, uh, Christian, uh, chick. The, uh, the blond?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: My name is Angela.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Hey, Angela! Roy. Nice to meet you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Aaaall right. Who's next, who's next, who's next, who's? Jim? You're next. Who would you do?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Um... Kevin, hands down. Yeah. He's really got that teddy bear thing going on, and afterwards, we could just watch bowling.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, I would definitely have sex with Ryan. 'Cause he is going to own his own business.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: You're all gay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Who's, uh... Who's next? Who we got? Whooo...

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: [answers phone] Hey, no, I can talk, I can talk, I can talk...  this is great timing.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Wish I had my cell phone, but I left it inside. So...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Would that make you happy?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What's that?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: If you had your cell phone, it would make you happy?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I'm on it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Dwight. Hey!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: You can't go in yet!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Dwight, don't! He is an idiot. The man is an idiot, ladies and gentlemen.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: What if he dies in the fire?  And that's the last thing you ever said to him.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I didn't say it to him. I said it about him.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: ...Jim.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Definitely Jim.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Definitely, definitely, Jim.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Come on, Pam.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: How about you Pam?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Um... Oscar's kind of cute.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Yeah, I like Oscar.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Ooh, Toby!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [in the background] How long does it take to find a cell phone? I don't know either.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Is there anybody else.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [clears his throat]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [on the phone] Hey, where are you? Oh good. Yeah. We're just here, we're playing Desert Island. It's when you pick your five favorite DVDs...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Seriously, where the hell is Dwight? Hey, call my cell phone. It'll make it easier for him to find.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: What's your number?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I gave it to you in the car.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Um...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I saw you program it in.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: You got to... you got to give it to me again.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay. Alright.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Now I have it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Uh, I better tell somebody. [to fireman] Excuse me, sir...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [coughing]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Dwight!? Great goin'. God, Man! Why did you go in there? What... Everybody was scared out of their wits, man? Oooh.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [coughing] Everyone, okay? Uh, I have an announcement. Apparently, in business school, they don't teach you how to operate a toaster oven. Because some smart, sexy temp left his cheese pita on oven instead of timing it for the toaster thing.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Wow. Okay. Well, I guess they don't teach how to operate a toaster oven in business school.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: That's exactly what I said.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, did you miss that day there, Ryan?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Were you absent?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Toaster Oven 101?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You failed?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I am so sorry.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey! I know what'll impress everybody, I'll start a fire. Oh, man. Bad idea. Bad idea jeans.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I have a song. Attention, everyone! That I want to sing. That I wrote especially for this occasion when I was up there among the flames. Ready? [sings to Billy Joel's "We Didn't Start the Fire"] Ryan started the fire! It was always burning since the world's been turning!

quotes.speaker: {dwight} and {michael}
quotes.text: [singing] Ryan started the fire! It was always burning--

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Everybody!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [singing] ...since the world was turning.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I can't believe I started the fire.

quotes.speaker: {dwight} and {michael}
quotes.text: [sing gibberish to "We Didn't Start the Fire"]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [singing]  ... Marilyn Monroe!

quotes.speaker: {dwight} and {michael}
quotes.text: [singing] Ryan started the fire! It was always burning...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Eat it! You gotta eat it. You have to eat it!

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: Hi!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: How are you?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Good, how are you?

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: I'm good. It's good to see you.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Good to see you, too.

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: I'm hungry.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah, I am too.

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: Oh, I have been thinking the whole way over and I have my answers.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What answers?

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: Um, for the... the desert island.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh! Right! Right, right, right, come-ah on, on, on. [to everyone] Ladies and gentlemen! Gather around! We have one more participant. Come on, be polite. Be polite. [to Katy] Desert Island. Five movies. Go.

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: Okay, um, first, Legally Blond.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I forgot what a super, nice girl Katy is. And just... good for Jim! They are so cute together. And, um, what an adorable car.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay, I think the game's over... People are like leaving. There was a bigger crowd last time. Do you just want to go to lunch?

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah?

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: Alright! You want to drive?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Sure.

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: Alright.

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: [looking at Roy and Pam] They are soo cute.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I'm really sorry, Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Answer me this, though.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Was it worth it? Was it worth it temp?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Was it worth it?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I'm really sorry, Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: The fire guy! The fire guy!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [sings] Joe McCarthy, Richard Nixon, Studebaker, television, North Korea, South Korea, Marilyn Monroe, Ryan started the fire!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay. Rule five - safety first,  i.e. don't burn the building down. Okay? That should be a no brainer.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh... look! Ryan is book smart. And I am street smart. And book smart.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I'll give you the rest of the ten tomorrow.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Seventy and clear, that's nice. Where's that?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: That's here.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I'm Michael's number two. He's one, I'm two. He's Alpha, I'm Beta. He's A, I'm B. It's easy. Whatever Michael is, I'm one less.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Rule three: Reach for the stars. And if you fail, see rule four. Rule four:

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I know Michael's every move. It's not something you can just pick up. I could write a book about him. Literally. I started once, but Michael made me stop.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hey, how's it going, man?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Good. What's up?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, nothing much. What's up with you?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I'm good, thanks.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Good. Good, I'm good, too. How's it cracking?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Uh, fine. What's up?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You know what you would love? Guns N' Roses. When I was your age, I loved Guns N' Roses. Do you like Guns N' Roses? I'll make you a tape.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Cool.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I'll make you two tapes.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I don't have a tape player. So...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Someday, temp. I've got a couple of shirts that don't fit so well anymore. I'll bring them by. Okay, see you later.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Michael and I have a very special connection, like an umbilical cord. And the thing is with Ryan is that I don't want him to trip on it, or get it caught around his neck.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Sixty-three, sixty-four, sixty-five, sixty-six, sixty-seven, sixty-eight. [snickering] Sixty-nine. Seventy. Seventy-one, seventy-two, seventy-three.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I like fire drills. You know what's the greatest? Like, when you were in school and the teacher would let you have class outside.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, the best.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah, it was great because it was like you're supposed to be working, but nothing ever gets done.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah, we had outside classes all the time and we never did anything.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [chuckling]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Actually if I had fewer outside classes, I probably wouldn't be stuck here at a paper company.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You're not stuck.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Yes, there is a real fire, but it's okay. Everyone got out fine. This is why you practice these things.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes, yes, I ran out first. A captain is always the first one on the ship and the last one off the ship. And this parking lot is our ship when the building is on fire. So, I ran out onto the ship.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay, DVDs. Five movies. What would you bring to the island? Toby, go ahead.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Say Anything, The Shining, Annie Hall, that's too obvious.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Those are like my favorite movies. I didn't really think you could win Desert Island, but I think you just did.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Toy Story 2, one of the best movies I ever saw. I went for my daughter and stayed because you can't leave your daughter in a theater.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Toby and I used to sit together until Michael moved us because he thought we talked too much.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Kevin, do it.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Uh, Cannonball Run, Cannonball Run II, [snickering] Weekend at Bernie's, Weekend at Bernie's II, and, oh, Groundhog Day.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Groundhog Day.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: I have a client who watches that movie once a week, at least.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: I should put you in touch with him. Maybe we could get together and work on that account.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I would love that.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay, guys, guys, guys. That almost sounded like business, and we are trying to focus here today, okay?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: When I was Ryan's age, I worked at Arby's and then I worked selling cutlery for a while. Cutlery that could decimate a penny, I kid you not. There were these shears that could cut straight through a penny. So I have life experience and work experience that Ryan doesn't, and will never have.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: And then you go to school for three years.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: For two years, and it's only at night, and then it's on your resume forever.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Wow. And just out of curiosity, how much is it?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: $650 bucks

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: A semester?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: A credit.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Wow.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: It's an investment.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, yeah, it sounds like it.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I think it's worth it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: If I could change the life of one person, just one person. I... Actually, that's shooting kind of low. I already did that when I was born. I changed two people's lives. Mom and Dad. Um, if I could change the lives of 5,000 people... 10,000. No, five. I'd be satisfied with 5,000. I... 10,000 though, that'd be something. Wow, 10,000 people. Because, you know what? Even one is amazing.
